title: Spicy Szechuan Green Beans Recipe
description: These Szechuan green beans get their spicy kick from red pepper flakes and freshly minced ginger in this flavorsome version of Chinese green beans.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Side Dish Vegetables Green Beans Spicy Szechuan Green Beans 4.7 (76) 54 Reviews 14 Photos These Szechuan green beans taste wonderful and are almost as good as takeout Chinese green beans! Their spicy flavor is wonderful with ham and a baked yam. Submitted by Tasha Updated on November 4, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 14 14 14 14 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings ½ pound green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces ¼ cup water 1 tablespoon minced ginger 2 cloves garlic, minced 1 teaspoon sesame oil 2 tablespoons soy sauce 1 tablespoon rice vinegar ½ teaspoon white sugar ¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes Directions Combine green beans and water in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until beans are tender-crisp, 4 to 5 minutes. Add ginger, garlic, and sesame oil; cook, stirring frequently, until garlic is fragrant and golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes. Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and red pepper flakes together in a small bowl. Pour over beans and cook until sauce thickens enough to coat beans, 3 to 5 minutes. I Made It Print 149 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Spicy Szechuan Green Beans 01 of 14 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 14 Photo by  TidyTea7589 04/19/2023 Delicious and very easy to make. I made some substitutions and added other ingredientes. Rice vinegar and sesame oil are not staples at home so I used apple vinegar and sunflower oil instead. My additions were white cabbage and champignons. For sure, I´ll make this recipe again and I think it´ll be a good idea to try it with other veggis such as carrots and zucchinis. Thank you, Tasha! 03 of 14 Photo by  Sandra Spencer 08/10/2021 04 of 14 Photo by  Erica De Shetler 03/31/2021 05 of 14 Photo by  SteveF 08/01/2020 I added more ginger cut into matchstick format, plus I used a tablespoon of sesame oil and a half teaspoon of crushed red pepper, this is an awesome recipe! 06 of 14 Photo by  SteveF 08/01/2020 I added more ginger cut into matchstick format, plus I used a tablespoon of sesame oil and a half teaspoon of crushed red pepper, this is an awesome recipe! 07 of 14 Photo by  Dancing_Child 01/24/2020 Yum! 08 of 14 Photo by  Shona Mackenzie 01/20/2020 I followed the recipe and they turned out great! Both my kids commented on how good the green beans were. 09 of 14 Photo by  Catherine Banning 01/14/2020 Yummy. I definitely recommend low sodium soy sauce though. 10 of 14 Photo by  Alisha 11/28/2019 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Green Beans with Maple-Dijon Vinaigrette 2 Ratings Szechuan Green Beans 1 Rating Japanese-Style Sesame Green Beans 471 Ratings Grandma's Green Beans with Bacon Vinaigrette 3 Ratings Green Beans Almondine 22 Ratings Italian Green Beans with Blue Cheese 4 Ratings Honey Ginger Green Beans 39 Ratings Anne's Amazing Roasted Green Beans 4 Ratings Quick Sesame Green Beans 172 Ratings Dad's Pan-Fried Green Beans 417 Ratings Garlic Green Beans 1,265 Ratings Microwave Garlic-and-Herb Green Beans 1 Rating Lemony Green Beans with Walnuts and Thyme 27 Ratings Green Beans Grilled in Foil 2 Ratings Creamy Green Beans Parmesan 52 Ratings Roasted Green Beans and Baby Red Potatoes 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Tasha
instructions: Combine green beans and water in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until beans are tender-crisp, 4 to 5 minutes. Add ginger, garlic, and sesame oil; cook, stirring frequently, until garlic is fragrant and golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes.;Mix soy sauce, rice vinegar, sugar, and red pepper flakes together in a small bowl. Pour over beans and cook until sauce thickens enough to coat beans, 3 to 5 minutes.
